name: Model UN Week
description: An event introducing how Model UN builds global awareness, civic engagement, and communication skills through simulation-based learning.

name: Women Build Sponsored Habitat for Humanity
description: A hands-on build and fundraising initiative that supports affordable housing while creating a supportive space for women volunteers and advocates.

name: Invasive Plant Removal at Wrightwood Park
description: A local environmental restoration event focused on removing invasive species and helping improve habitat health at Wrightwood Park.

name: Teen Science Cafe
description: An informal evening event for teens featuring conversations with STEM professionals, hands-on activities, and a relaxed environment designed to spark curiosity and exploration.

name: Future Teacher Conference at UNCW
description: The Future Teacher Conference invites high school, community college, and homeschool students to UNCW for a day exploring life as a Watson student. Participants attend interactive sessions led by faculty and staff, along with a student panel focused on education careers.

name: Engineering Open House at NC State
description: The annual College of Engineering Open House at NC State offers prospective students and families an opportunity to explore engineering programs and learn more about the college.

name: Jambalaya Soul Slam
description: A spoken word and poetry event celebrating creative writing, performance, and storytelling.

name: Jambalaya Soul Slam Academy Writing & Performance Workshop
description: The Jambalaya Soul Academy provides poetry workshops that offer writing strategies, prompts, and opportunities to develop and share poems with other writers.

name: Morehead Observatory Guest Night
description: The Department of Physics and Astronomy hosts a weekly public astronomy program at the Morehead Observatory, featuring a short presentation, observatory tour, and telescope viewing when weather permits.

name: JA Inspire Career Expo
description: Junior Achievement of Eastern NC offers early career-focused programs to help students explore future pathways before high school. JA Inspire extends learning beyond the classroom by connecting students to career opportunities and planning for high school, college, and beyond.

name: JA Stock Market Challenge
description: Teams of 3–4 students use $500,000 in mock stock to trade fictitious companies during a fast-paced, 60-day simulated market. The objective is to earn the highest return, with top teams qualifying for the Junior Achievement national competition.

name: UNC Science Expo
description: The UNC Science Expo, hosted by Morehead Planetarium and Science Center, is a large annual science festival featuring hands-on activities, demonstrations, and exhibits led by UNC-Chapel Hill students, faculty, and community partners.

name: Durham Arts Council - The Art of the Party
description: The Art of the Party is a lively celebration of Durham’s creative spirit, bringing together music, food, culture, and community while supporting the arts through an immersive event and live auction.

name: Carolina Jazz Festival
description: Enjoy live jazz performances by touring bands, artists in residence, and UNC Department of Music faculty and students at this annual February festival celebrating jazz.

name: Nevermore Film Festival
description: Founded in 1999, this juried festival showcases horror, science fiction, mystery, thriller, animated, and dark fantasy films from around the world at the Carolina Theatre. With over 1,000 films screened, it is internationally recognized as a leading genre film festival.

name: Art in Bloom at the North Carolina Museum of Art
description: This art and flower festival at the North Carolina Museum of Art highlights regional floral designers who create arrangements inspired by the museum’s artwork. Proceeds from the event support the NCMA Foundation.

name: GRAHAM100: The Centennial Celebration
description: The Martha Graham Dance Company returns to Carolina Performing Arts for its 12th appearance with GRAHAM100: The Centennial Celebration. The program marks the culmination of the company’s three-season 100th anniversary celebration and explores the question, “What is an American?”

name: Eclipse
description: Culture Mill returns with a remount of Eclipse, a Carolina Performing Arts–commissioned work that invites audiences and artists to imagine collective monument building. Held outdoors at CURRENT ArtSpace, the performance uses movement and restorative justice practices to explore how shared bodies and stories can create new forms of togetherness.

name: Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis
description: The Jazz at Lincoln Center Orchestra with Wynton Marsalis returns to Carolina Performing Arts, delivering a vibrant performance that blends swing, soul, and storytelling through their signature sound and dynamic chemistry.

name: Mahler Chamber Orchestra
description: The Mahler Chamber Orchestra returns to Memorial Hall for its fourth Carolina Performing Arts appearance, presenting an evening of music by Prokofiev and Hindemith. The performance is led by GRAMMY Award–winning pianist Yuja Wang, who directs from the piano and is celebrated for her expressive artistry.

name: Shakori Hills Grassroots
description: Shakori Hills GrassRoots is a biannual, family-friendly festival in Pittsboro, North Carolina that celebrates music, dance, art, and education. Organized by the nonprofit Shakori Hills Community Arts Center, the festival features diverse musical acts, workshops, kids’ activities, crafts, and camping.

name: Triangle Trails Summit
description: The Triangle Trails Summit brings regional leaders, planners, and advocates together at Dix Chapel for a day focused on the future of the Triangle’s greenways and blueways. Through keynotes, discussions, and networking, the annual event explores ways to strengthen connectivity, accessibility, and sustainability across the region’s trail network.

name: Snow White - Carolina Ballet
description: This production brings the classic fairytale Snow White to life while exploring timeless themes of self-reflection and comparison. Choreographed by Artistic Director and CEO Zalman Raffael, with an original score by Shinji Eshima, the performance offers a thoughtful and modern interpretation of the beloved story.

name: North Carolina Symphony Beethoven Emperor Concerto
description: Beethoven’s bold and innovative “Emperor” Piano Concerto will be brought to life by guest soloist Anne-Marie McDermott, alongside Bartók’s vibrant Concerto for Orchestra, with Music Director Carlos Miguel Prieto leading the performance.

name: Appalachian Spring with the North Carolina Symphony
description: Music Director Carlos Miguel Prieto leads a program featuring Copland’s iconic Appalachian Spring, along with Gabriela Ortiz’s Kauyumari and Revueltas’s La Noche de los Mayas.

name: Beauty and the Beast - Carolina Ballet
description: Artistic Director Zalman Raffael unveils a world premiere, Beauty and the Beast, reimagining the timeless tale with fresh creativity and heart. Presented as a new full-length ballet with live music, the production draws audiences into a vividly realized world.

name: Shakespeare in the Park
description: Catch As You Like It at the Knightdale Station Park amphitheater. This abridged performance follows Rosalind, banished from court and in disguise, as she navigates mistaken identities, humor, and romance in the Forest of Arden. With witty banter and Shakespeare’s beautiful poetry, it’s a light, enjoyable way to experience the play outdoors or on a busy schedule.

name: Chapel Hill Events Guide
description: Enjoy great food, live music, and more. Discover a rich arts and history scene through museums, historic homes, murals, and live performances. Take in the area’s natural beauty along greenways, trails, preserves, and riverwalks. Browse shops for one-of-a-kind finds like vintage treasures, locally made pottery, or classic Tar Heel souvenirs.

name: Discover Durham - Events Guide
description: Every day in the Bull City, there’s something happening. With thousands of Durham-based events each year, you’ll find concerts, festivals, fundraisers, art shows, and community gatherings for all ages and interests—perfect for locals and visitors alike.

name: Bull City Madness
description: Bull City Madness returns on Saturday, April 25, 2026, bringing Durham’s 3v3 basketball tournament back to celebrate the city’s deep basketball legacy. The event unites the community through friendly competition while raising awareness and support for local organizations doing meaningful work in Durham.
